nouns.definition: A building for human habitation.
A small domesticated carnivorous mammal with soft fur.
A large natural elevation of the earth's surface.
A vehicle consisting of two wheels held in a frame.
A woody perennial plant.
A printed work consisting of pages glued or sewn together.
A large keyboard musical instrument with a wooden case.
A container with a flat base and sides.
A hard protective outer case of a crustacean.
A glass surface which reflects a clear image.
A rigid structure that surrounds something such as a picture.
The extent of the area or subject matter that something deals with.
The the natural agent that stimulates sight and makes things visible.
A set of hard, bony enamel-coated structures in the jaws.
A weapon with a long metal blade and a hilt with a hand guard.
The burning of material, giving off heat and light.
A private four-wheeled vehicle.
A fast-running, long-eared mammal.
A colourless, transparent, odourless liquid.
A visible mass of condensed watery vapour.
A bone framework enclosing the brain of a vertebrate.
A form of energy resulting from the existence of charged particles.
An oval or round object laid by a female bird or reptile.
A device consisting of a circular canopy used as protection against rain.
A stone consisting of a clear crystalline form of pure carbon.
A large plant-eating domesticated mammal with solid hoofs.
A soft white fibrous substance which surrounds the seeds of a plant.
A visual art that is typically drawn and frequently animated.
The expanse of salt water that covers most of the earth's surface.
A circular ornamental headdress worn by a monarch.
Cured meat from the back or sides of a pig.
A food made of flour, water, and yeast mixed together and baked.
A sweet food made from roasted and ground cacao seed kernels.
A hollow muscular organ that pumps blood through the circulatory system.
A starchy plant tuber which is one of the most important food crops.
A room used as a place for professional work.
A long, narrow box in which a dead body is buried.
A body fluid in the circulatory system which provides oxygen to cells.
A set of instructions for preparing a particular dish.
A course along which someone or something moves.
A person who helps students to acquire knowledge.
The mother of one's father or mother.
A male who shares one or more parents with another.
A person with whom one has a bond of mutual affection.
The anniversary of the day on which a person was born.
The state of the atmosphere at a particular place and time.
A public road in a city or town.
An alcoholic drink made from yeast-fermented malt.
A worker that performs specific tasks for a business.
A medium of exchange in the form of coins and banknotes.
